page.title: 12The Smithy at Balmullo
page.content:
Mr. Wilson, the blacksmith, has provided shoes for up to twenty-four horses in one day! This is still quite an important part of his work. Sometimes the horses come to the smithy but Mr. Wilson and his son also travel out to farms to shoe horses, with portable equipment. In fact, Mr. Wilson has even travelled to England for his customers! However, most of his business is within about fifteen miles of Balmullo.
As well as shoeing horses, Mr. Wilson also repairs farm machinery and makes things such as wrought-iron grates. For this he has a lot of heavy machinery such as a grinder, welding equipment and cutters.
